;;微笑的史蒂夫·马丁
;

;美国演员、喜剧演员和热心的土著艺术收藏家史蒂夫·马丁已被宣布作为一部新故事片的执行制片人，该电影描绘了西部沙漠艺术运动的起源。

;

;马丁，世界顶级;澳大利亚原住民艺术收藏家;还参与了《蜜蚁梦想家》的剧本开发，该片将于 2024 年在北领地的帕普尼亚、麦克唐纳山脉和爱丽斯泉附近拍摄。

;

;“我很荣幸成为其中的一员这个令人兴奋且有价值的项目，”这位《新娘之父》明星说道。2015 年，他参加了 Warlimpirrnga Tjapaltjarri 的纽约个展后，激发了他对原住民艺术的热情。 “它向等待的世界呈现了一个鲜为人知但震撼人心的故事。”

;

;《蜜蚁梦想家》将由 ;Warumpi Band 创始人 Sammy Butcher;，居住在 Papunya，一个小社区爱丽丝泉西北 260 公里处。

;
;

;;相关：;;你现在可以走了评论——关于土著艺术家理查德·贝尔的纪录片充满争议性和有趣;

;
;

;北领地政府的银幕地区制作吸引力激励计划已向该项目注入 45 万澳元，这标志着编剧、导演兼执行制片人 Michael Cordell（因 SBS 系列<< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/oct/03/go-back-to-where-you-came-from-live-is-ambitious-tv-but- does-it-work">;回到你来自哪里;）以及联合编剧兼联合导演 Pitjantjara、Luritja 和 Warlpiri 女性 Anyupa Emily Napangarti Butcher。

;
    ;
  • ; < p>;;;注册澳大利亚卫报的免费上午和下午电子邮件通讯，以获取每日新闻摘要;< /strong>;

    ;
    • ;
;

;这部电影讲述了悉尼教师杰弗里·巴登 (Geoffrey Bardon) 的故事，他于 1971 年在 Papunya 小学任教，在那里他鼓励社区中的成年人画一幅他们的蜂蜜蚂蚁做梦的壁画。这幅壁画的主要艺术家、企业家和传统长者 Kaapa Tjampitjinpa 在催生一场艺术运动中发挥了重要作用，该运动将画在沙子上和身体上的神圣故事转移到画布上。

;

;“当代原住民和托雷斯海峡岛民艺术的开创性源于帕普尼亚绘画人的创新、激进和创业思维，他们希望在同化时代保持自己的文化活力。”安尤帕·布彻 (Anyupa Butcher) 说道。

;

;“这个故事是既古代又现代。本地和全球。我们的艺术始于沙子、岩石，以及澳大利亚的形成。

;

;“这些画家有着共同的愿景，即维护文化法则，同时向世界分享我们从帕普尼亚到世界的独特文化集体。”

;

; >;

;Screen Territory 导演珍妮·休斯 (Jennie Hughes) 表示，在澳大利亚中部拍摄《蜜蚁梦想家》将“为当地社区带来巨大利益”。

;

;“这部作品不仅将展示北领地一个充满活力和吸引力的全球目的地，同时也凸显了 Papunya 艺术运动的才华和创新。”

;

;Savage Films，一家由 Maggie Miles 掌舵的澳大利亚制作公司 (;高地;，;他在 2022 年接受 ArtNews; 采访时说道。“有一个非常具体的本土元素——梦想背景——那就是[对外人来说] 几乎无法接近。它可以追溯到几千年前。”

;;恒大工地
;

;陷入困境的中国房地产巨头恒大已暂停香港股票交易该公司在停牌 17 个月后恢复交易仅一个月。

;

;根据证监会发布的通知，其另外两个部门——物业服务和电动汽车集团——也于周四上午 9 点停止交易。股票交易所。

;

;交易停止的第二天，有报道称;恒大董事长已被警方监视;。据彭博社报道，1996 年创立恒大的许家印于本月早些时候被带走，目前正在指定地点受到监视。

;

;目前尚不清楚许家印为何会被监视居住。这不构成正式拘留或警方逮捕，也不意味着刑事指控。

;
;

;;相关：;;任何其他名称的庞氏骗局：中国房地产泡沫的破裂;

;
;

;恒大集团于8月28日才恢复交易;因未公布财务业绩而被停牌 17 个月。本月早些时候，恒大财富管理部门的几名员工;在深圳被捕;，罪名不明。

;

;据报道，两名前高管最近也被拘留。去年，134亿元人民币（15亿英镑）的存款被用作第三方贷款担保的消息曝光后，潘大荣和夏海军辞职。

;

;本周早些时候，恒大地产旗下恒大地产中国大陆的主要单位未能支付40亿元人民币债券的本金和利息。许先生于2021年辞去恒大董事长职务。

;

;周日，恒大表示，由于恒大正在接受调查，无法发行新债。

;

;周五，恒大表示计划召开会议本周，一项关键的债务重组计划不会实施，并补充说“有必要重新评估该计划的条款”，以适应“客观形势和债权人的要求”。

;

;中国房地产行业是增长的关键支柱——与建筑业一样，它约占GDP的四分之一——并且在近几十年来经历了令人眼花缭乱的繁荣。

;

;该行业最大的参与者积累的巨额债务已经，然而，近年来，北京方面将其视为对金融体系和整体经济健康的不可接受的风险。

;

;自 2020 年以来，当局逐渐收紧开发商的信贷准入，随之而来的是一波违约潮 — — 值得注意的是恒大集团。

;

;另一家中国房地产巨头碧桂园，;在报告创纪录的损失和超过 1500 亿美元的债务后，近几个月勉强避免了违约;。

;;印度尼西亚服装摊贩
;

;印度尼西亚已禁止在社交媒体平台上进行商品交易，其目的是保护小企业免受电子商务竞争。

;

;近几个月来，要求制定社交媒体和电子商务监管法规的呼声越来越高，线下卖家发现自己的生计受到 TikTok Shop 和 TikTok 上廉价产品销售的威胁。其他平台。

;

;印度尼西亚是 TikTok Shop 全球最大的市场之一，也是第一个试点该应用电子商务部门的国家。

;

;“现在，电子商务无法成为社交媒体媒体。它是分开的，”贸易部长 Zulkifli Hasan 在新闻发布会上表示，并补充说，贸易法规于周二生效。

;

;Hasan 表示，社交商务平台将有一周的时间来遵守新规则。 .

;
;

;;相关：;;创新与剥削：印度的电子商务繁荣有可能颠覆当地企业和工人权利;

;
;

;“任何政府都会保护当地的小企业，”他说，并将该法规描述为确保“商业竞争平等”的一种方式。

;

;该法规意味着社交商务公司现在监管文件称，“禁止在其电子系统中进行支付交易”。

;

;“社交商务可以像电视一样投放广告，但不得是交易性的。 [他们]不能开店，不能直接销售，”哈桑说道，但没有提及 TikTok 的名字。

;

;不遵守规定的公司最终可能会被吊销在印度尼西亚开展业务的许可证。<根据公司数据，印度尼西亚拥有 1.25 亿用户，是 TikTok 仅次于美国的第二大全球市场。但该国现已成为该地区第一个对该平台在社交媒体商务中日益普及采取行动的国家。

;

;TikTok Indonesia 表示，该公司对该政策“深感担忧”，该政策将影响数百万卖家

;

;“我们尊重当地法律法规，并将寻求建设性的前进道路，”它表示。

;

;拥有 Facebook 和 Instagram 的 Meta 没有回应评论请求。

;

;哈桑似乎确认这些公司必须在单独的社交媒体和电子商务许可证之间进行选择。

;

;“很明显......没有许可证社交商务。如果[他们]想要社交商务，请仅用于促销和广告。如果[他们]想出售，有电子商务[许可证]。”

;

;该法规还规定，在电子商务平台上从印尼卖家处购买的某些外国商品的最低价格为100美元。

;

;印度尼西亚的电子商务市场由 Tokopedia、Shopee 和 Lazada 等平台主导，但 TikTok Shop 自 2021 年推出以来获得了显着的市场份额。

;
;

; ;相关：;;卖家抵制 Etsy英国因销售收入上涨而被保留在储备金中;

;
;

;专家表示，交易禁令将打击 TikTok 等社交媒体平台的金库，该平台从每笔销售中收取佣金。雅加达经济与金融发展研究所执行董事 Tauhid Ahmad 表示：“他们肯定会蒙受损失。”雅加达牛仔裤批发商 Stevanie Ahua 对此表示赞赏。政府的决定，称近几个月来，由于买家转向网上商店，她的收入下降了 60%。

;

;巴厘岛的 Bur 饼干面包师 Panji Made Agung 表示，他对这项禁令感到失望。

;

;“对于像我这样的卖家来说，TikTok 可以用来进行软销售。我们可以同时成为影响者和卖家，”他说。

;GB News 已暂停主持人丹·伍顿的职务右翼新闻频道周三表示：“在劳伦斯·福克斯对丹·伍顿的节目发表评论后，英国新闻频道已暂停丹·伍顿的职务。”昨夜。在此之前，我们今天早些时候决定正式暂停福克斯先生的职务。我们正在进行全面调查。”

;

;GB News ;多次拒绝调查;伍顿对他使用 ;化名 Martin Branning; 向前同事发送露骨的色情信息。

; < p>;40 岁的伍顿已经面临 MailOnline 和 ;因这些历史指控而使他和他在英国新闻社的前雇主停职。因此，他现在正在接受三个独立媒体集团就各种问题进行的调查。

;

;最新的丑闻始于周二晚上，当时福克斯出现在英国新闻的丹·伍顿今夜节目中，讨论了政治记者艾娃·埃文斯 (Ava Evans) 关于男性心理健康的问题。

;

;福克斯没有专注于她的论点，而是利用时间讨论了这位记者的外表，并解释了为什么他会在酒吧里忽视她。

; < p>;他称埃文斯为“小女人”，并接着说道：“给我展示一个有自尊心的男人，愿意永远和那个不是非独身者的女人爬上床。

;

;“我们需要强大、坚强、出色的女性，为自己做出伟大的贡献。我们不需要这种女权主义4.0。他们既可悲又令人尴尬。谁想和它上床？”

;

;福克斯和伍顿都笑了，福克斯补充道：“抱歉，这是真的。”

; ;

;Evans，他在 X（以前称为 Twitter 的社交媒体网站）上发布了该片段的剪辑– 节目播出后，她表示这些评论让她感到“身体不适”。

;

;周三，埃文斯表示她已收到英国新闻频道的道歉。

;

;“这是一封来自英国新闻频道的电子邮件。编辑 - 一封非常亲切的电子邮件 - 基本上告诉我福克斯所说的内容并不代表英国新闻机构的其他部分，”她告诉 BBC 新闻播客。

;

;“这实际上可能是我最好的道歉本来可以得到的。老实说，并不是要对我们的媒体格局产生怀疑，但我实际上并不认为会发生任何事情。

;

;“我不想说我对此感到高兴。 I just think that's probably the best outcome I could have hoped for.”

;

;Evans added that she had received threats in a “really nasty” past 24 hours.

;

;During the discussion on Tuesday, Wootton could be seen smirking, although he did attempt to steer the conversation elsewhere before concluding: “And she's a very beautiful woman, Laurence, very beautiful woman.”

;

;Afterwards, following a social media backlash, Wootton issued an apology and insisted he was laughing only out of shock at Fox's comments.

;

;He said: “Having looked at the footage, I can see how inappropriate my reaction to his totally unacceptable remarks appears to be and want to be clear that I was in no way amused by the comments … I should have intervened immediately to challenge offensive and misogynistic remarks.”

;

;Fox, also a presenter on GB News, was suspended by the channel on Wednesday morning after politicians and fellow GB News staff expressed their disgust at his comments.

;

;Fox, 45, then turned his fire on Wootton, suggesting his apology and justification for the laughter were not sincere.

;

;Fox shared a screengrab of a private Twitter conversation from just after the broadcast, captioned with the words “Honesty is the best policy”, that appeared to show Wootton posting a number of laughing emojis in response Fox's comments about Evans.

;

;It is rare for the rightwing GB News channel, which has encountered many controversies and multiple regulatory inquiries during its short existence, to issue an apology.

;

;The media regulator, Ofcom, which has struggled to deal with GB News pushing the boundaries of British TV regulation, said it was urgently looking into a large number of complaints about Fox's comments.

;

;The media regulator has six separate investigations into GB News still going, with the channel already found to have breached the broadcasting code on three different occasions within the last year.

;

;GB News has close links to the Conservative government, receiving preferential access to ministers and spending hundreds of thousands of pounds a year employing Tory MPs as presenters.

;

;Wootton and Fox's comments could also cause a headache for Paul Marshall, the hedge fund billionaire who provides much of the financial backing for GB News.

;

;He is putting together a bid to buy the Daily Telegraph but could face challenges if he is not considered an appropriate buyer for the title due to the conduct of his other media businesses.

;

;Lucy Frazer, the culture secretary, said Fox's comments were “inappropriate and unacceptable”, while her Labour opposite number, Thangam Debbonaire, put the episode in the context of society-wide misogyny.

;

;She said: “Last night's woman-hating on air has hit a new low. Might want to ask why a national broadcaster would want to keep this man on air. Women are mighty and we will never let voices like this silence us.”

; Thu, 28 Sep 2023 06:52:01 +0800 Meta to launch AI chatbots played by Snoop Dogg and Kendall Jennerhttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/sep/27/meta-to-launch-ai-chatbots-played-by-snoop-dogg-and-kendall-jenner
;;2023-09-27T19:40:36Z;
;
;;Mark Zuckerberg during Met'as annual Connect conference.
;

;Meta is to launch artificial intelligence chatbots embodied by celebrities including Snoop Dogg, Kendall Jenner and Naomi Osaka.

;

;Mark Zuckerberg made the announcement at the company's annual Connect conference, where he spoke about new AI products at Facebook's parent company.

;

;The chatbots will feature unique interests and allow users to receive personalised advice, with the intention that they will be more interactive and fun to use.

; ;

;Meta will launch more than ;28 of these AIs in beta;, with some played by celebrities. Snoop Dogg will be “Dungeon Master”, who will assist users to play adventure games, the former basketball player Dwyane Wade will be an AI called “Victor” designed to help users work out, Osaka will be anime-obsessed “Tamika”, and Jenner will be “Billie”, a “big sis” referred to as a “ride-or-die companion”.

;

;The other bots have been trained to answer queries on topics such as writing speeches and cooking – for example, sous chef “Max” will help users come up with recipes.

;

;Earlier this week, the ;Wall Street Journal; reported that Meta's early tests with the bot were met with problems. One document seen by the WSJ found that one employee found the chatbot to be rude and did not understand its personality.

;

;“This isn't just about answering queries, it's about entertainment,” said Zuckerberg, Meta's CEO. He added that there may be some limitations as the chatbots do not have access to real-time information at present. That will be added in the coming months, he said.

;

;This move is said to be Meta's attempt to appeal to younger audiences and allow them to connect and interact with the AIs.

; ;

;During the announcement, Zuckerberg said that most people have not been able to experience AI and Meta is seeking to address that through bringing them into apps that billions of people use.

;

;

;“Those companies will end up being liquidated … the judge has already determined that the fraud existed,” Cohen told CNN, hailing Engoron's pretrial ruling in a civil case brought by Letitia James, the New York attorney general.

;

;Trump's lawyers said they would appeal the rescinding of the licenses, the appointment of receivers, and Engoron's assertion that Trump and executives lived in a “fantasy world” of routinely, repeatedly and illegally overvaluing property values and his personal net worth to gain favorable loan terms and reduced insurance premiums.

;But if the appeals are unsuccessful, the collapse of the Trump empire, upon which the former reality TV host ;staked his reputation; as a successful business tycoon, could be imminent.

;

;In his post on Wednesday, Trump decried the judge's $18m valuation of Mar-a-Lago, claiming it was worth “100 times more than he values it”.

;

;William Black, a white-collar criminologist, corporate fraud investigator and distinguished scholar in residence for financial regulation at the University of Minnesota law school, said: “In finance, once the dominoes start falling, it becomes basically impossible to save it.

;

;“These properties are even more damaged goods today because of the success in demonstrating they are massively overvalued. ;

;Black, who helped expose congressional wrongdoing in the ;Lincoln Savings and Loans scandal; of the 1980s, in which the financier Charles Keating inflated his company's worth to bilk taxpayers for billions, called Engoron's ruling “devastating”. ;

;“What we experienced in the Savings and Loan debacle, we would put in an honest manager and employees would start coming to that person over time and say, 'You know, you really ought to look at this,'” Black said.

;

;“Trump is monumentally, stupidly greedy in that he isn't actually paying for a number of key lieutenants in terms of their legal needs, and they're facing financial collapse of their own, [such as] the Rudy Giulianis of this world. But a lot of folks can sink Trump.

;

;“Having this ability to control all these assets, even if they're massively overvalued, meant hope springs eternal among the Trump folks that he can use that money and influence to help them, but if Trump instead ends up bereft of control over the overwhelming bulk of his assets, and has lots of liabilities, sugar daddy goes away.”

;“This is New York's corporate death penalty, applied to Trump because of years of misconduct,” she ;wrote on X;, formerly Twitter.

; Thu, 28 Sep 2023 03:22:01 +0800 First evidence of spinning black hole detected by scientistshttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/sep/27/first-evidence-of-spinning-black-hole-detected-by-scientists
;;2023-09-27T17:31:04Z;
;
;;The Event Horizon Telescope captured the black hole at the centre of galaxy M87 in April 2019.
;

;Astronomers have captured the first direct evidence of a black hole spinning, providing new insights into the universe's most enigmatic objects.

;

;The observations focus on the supermassive black hole at the centre of the neighbouring Messier 87 galaxy, whose shadow ;was imaged by the Event Horizon Telescope;. Like many supermassive black holes, M87 features powerful jets that are launched from the poles at close to the speed of light into intergalactic space.

;

;Scientists have predicted that the rotation of a black hole powers these cosmic jets, but until now direct evidence was elusive.

;

;“After the success of black hole imaging in this galaxy with the Event Horizon Telescope, whether this black hole is spinning or not has been a central concern among scientists,” said Dr Kazuhiro Hada, of the national astronomical observatory of Japan and co-author. “Now anticipation has turned into certainty. This monster black hole is indeed spinning.”

;

;M87 is located 55m light years from the Earth and harbours a black hole 6.5bn times more massive than the Sun. Just beyond the black hole is an accretion disk of gas and dust, swirling on the precipice of the cosmic sinkhole. Some of this material is destined to fall into the black hole, disappearing for ever. But a fraction will be ejected out from the poles of the black hole at more than 99.99% of the speed of light.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Eureka! Scientists explore mysteries of black holes with hi-tech bathtub;

;
;

;Theoretical models suggest that the black hole's spin is responsible for this phenomenon. Scientists think that charged particles in the disk produce a powerful magnetic field and that as the black hole spins, it drags the field with it. This winds up the field in a way that can accelerate particles away from the black hole as jets, extracting energy from the rotation of the black hole in the process.

;

;The latest work, ;published in Nature;, used observations of M87 from a global network of radio telescopes taken from 2000 to 2022. This revealed a recurring 11-year cycle in the jet, which was found to precess around a central point at the edge of the black hole. This indicated a misalignment between the black hole's spin axis and the accretion disk, leading the jet to wobble like a spinning top.

;

;“Detecting this precession provides unequivocal evidence that the supermassive black hole in M87 is indeed spinning, thus enhancing our understanding of the nature of supermassive black holes,” the authors said.

;

;Dr Ziri Younsi, an astrophysicist at UCL, said: “That's exciting because it's telling us that it can only precess if the black hole has non-zero spin. It's an indirect but extremely strong confirmation of spin.”

;

;Younsi added that a black hole's spin could, in future, give insights into the cataclysmic events that led to the formation of the supermassive black hole. “The fact that it's spinning and there's a tilt tells you that something pretty crazy happened in the past,” he said. “At some point in its history, something violent happened. It provides tantalising hints that that might be the case.”
